title: Memorials of Edinburgh in the olden time
author: Wilson, Daniel
snippet: It was then thought that it must have been accompanied by a portrait of James ; and it is exceedingly probable that others of equal value to theone thus accidentally preserved, may have been thrown aside and destroyed with the discarded pannelling. This curious portrait is now in the possession of Alexander Mackay, Esq. of Blackcastle. It represents the Queen in a high-bordered lace cap and ruff, such as both she and her daughter are usually painted with.
